be.ac.ulg.montefiore.run.jadti
Class DecisionTree

java.lang.Object
  be.ac.ulg.montefiore.run.jadti.DecisionTree
Direct Known Subclasses:
LearningDecisionTree
public class DecisionTree
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a decision tree.

A decision tree is a tree where a test has been assigned to non-leaf nodes. Its aim is to guess the value of an item's attribute (called the 'goal' attribute) thanks to tests over other attributes.

If the topology of the tree is changed, take must be taken to create a valid tree, i.e. an acyclic graph where all the sons of one node are different.

The tree is composed of 3 types of nodes:

  • TestNodes: They are associated to a test over items' attributes. A test node has as many sons as the test's number of different outcomes.
  • LeafNodes: They have no sons. A leaf node is associated a goal attribute value.
  • OpenNode: A node whose purpose has not been found yet. It can be replaced by a test/leaf node later on. The tree's open nodes can be efficiently (in log(nbNodes) on average) retreived.

public DecisionTree(AttributeSet attributeSet,
                    SymbolicAttribute goalAttribute)
Creates a empty decision tree.

Parameters:
attributeSet - A set of attribute. The set of attributes of the items given to this tree. Can be set to 'null'.
goalAttribute - The goalAttribute. Can be set to 'null'.
Method Detail

guessGoalAttribute

public KnownSymbolicValue guessGoalAttribute(Item item)
Guess goal attribute value of an item.

Parameters:
item - The item compatible with the tree attribute set.
Returns:
The goal attribute value, or -1 if the matching leaf node does not define a goal attribute.

leafNode

public Node leafNode(Item item)
Finds the leaf/open node matching an item. All the (tested) attributes of the item must be known.

Parameters:
item - An item compatible with the tree attribute set.
Returns:
The leaf node matching item.

goalValueDistribution

public double[] goalValueDistribution(Item item)
Finds the goal value distribution matching an item. This distribution describes the probability of each potential goal value for this item.

Parameters:
item - An item compatible with the tree attribute set.
Returns:
The goal attribute value distribution for the item item.

Check if a given node is the root node.

true iff the argument is the root node of this tree.

Change this tree's attribute set. The set of attributes of the items given to this tree.

attributeSet - The new attribute set. Can be set to 'null'.

getAttributeSet

public AttributeSet getAttributeSet()
Returns this tree's attribute set.

Returns:
This tree's attribute set. A 'null' value means thaht the set is undefined.

setGoalAttribute

public void setGoalAttribute(SymbolicAttribute goalAttribute)
Change this tree's goal attribute. The goal attribute is the attribute guessed by the tree.

Parameters:
goalAttribute - The new tree's goal attribute. Can be set to 'null' if unknown.

getGoalAttribute

public SymbolicAttribute getGoalAttribute()
Get this tree's goal attribute. The goal attribute is the attribute guessed by the tree.

Returns:
The tree's goal attribute. Returns 'null' if unknown.

openNode

public OpenNode openNode()
Returns the leftmost open node of the tree. 'Leftmost' means that the son chosen at each test node while descending the tree is the smallest number.

Returns:
The leftmost open node of the tree, or null if the tree has no open node.

hasOpenNode

public boolean hasOpenNode()
Checks if the tree has open nodes.

Returns:
true iff the tree has open nodes.

breadthFirstIterator

public java.util.Iterator breadthFirstIterator()
Returns the nodes of the tree. The iterator returns the node according to a breadth first search. The sons of a node are returned left to right (i.e. with increasing son number).

Returns:
An iterator over the tree's nodes.
